Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); LATE PERIOD ?; PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Head of a young king
Description: This model represents the head of a young king carved in profile. He is wearing a cap which embraces the shape of the skull and which has the appearance of the sidelock charateristic of children. A large uraeus ornaments the front. The head is also distinguished by the pupils painted in black and  a double chin. It is a strong possibilty that the piece is a perfect cast.
